OwnerUser.AboutMe: I recently graduated from Marquette University, but I'll always be a student. I'm currently earning master's degree in Applied Spanish Linguistics through NYU in Madrid. I also recently earned my TESOL certificate from the University of Milwaukee-Wisconsin. Language is one of my loves in life, along with tea and Futurama.

Body:
I'll also throw in that some languages also have grammatical gender in their verbs. Polish, for example (I assume other Slavic languages do as well, but I'm only familiar with Polish).

Examples:

  • chciałbym = I would like (male speaking)
  • chciałabym = I would like (female speaking)
  • byłem = I was (male speaking)
  • byłam = I was (female speaking)
